title: Eisa festivals on Okinawa
text:
Military Life Eisa festivals on Okinawa 60TH ALL OKINAWA EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 4, 6-9 p.m. at the Goya crossroads; Sept. 5, 3-9 p.m., Sept. 6, 2:30-9 p.m. at Okinawa City Koza Athletic Park; groups from Okinawa perform Eisa, Sanshin and taiko at Koza Athletic Park Athletic Field; fireworks at 8:45 p.m.. Photo courtesy of All Okinawa Eisa Festival Committee Published: August 3, 2015 Events are as accurate as possible at press time. Since times or event schedules can change, please verify events before attending. Eisa is a traditional Okinawan dance with taiko drums during Obon, a Buddhist holiday to honor the spirits of ancestors. Okinawa 
August GINOWAN HAGOROMO FESTIVAL: Aug. 8 & 9, 3-9 p.m.; traditional parade in costume marches on Kankaimon, Convention and Naka streets, youth Eisa performances, 1,800 fireworks display 9-9:20 p.m. and more at Ocean Park Multi-purpose Square; free; 098-897-2764. 
OGIMI VILLAGE EISA FESTIVAL: Aug 8 & 9, 1-9 p.m.; Eisa dance along with performances and attractions; youth Eisa groups’ performance and fireworks 8 p.m. on Sunday; Shioya Fishery Port; 098-44-3007. 
OKINAWA CHILDREN’S KINGDOM EISA FESTIVAL: Aug. 8 & 9, 4-9 p.m.; Eisa dancers and taiko drummers from 30 communities gather at Okinawa Children’s Kingdom; children’s Eisa groups perform 4 p.m., youth Eisa groups 6:30 p.m.; 500 yen adults, 200 yen junior and senior high school students, 100 yen children; 098-933-4190. 
KINCHO YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Aug. 9, 5-9 p.m.; youth Eisa groups from each district in Kincho participate in this festival, which includes fireworks at 8:30 p.m.; Kin-District Park; 80-minute drive from Naha Airport or five-minute drive from Kin IC on Okinawa Express; 098-968-8996. 
ITOMAN FURUSATO (HOMETOWN) FESTIVAL: Aug. 15 & 16, 1-9:30 p.m.; local products and crafts on sale, and also Eisa and fireworks at 9 p.m. Sat. and 8:55 p.m. Sun.; Itoman Fishing Port North District; free; 30-minute drive from Naha Airport; 098-840-8135. 
YAMBARU YOUTH EISA MATSURI: Aug. 23, 5 p.m.; youth Eisa groups from Motobu town perform at Motobu-cho Tancha Koen, 90-minute drive from Naha Airport; 0980-47-5211. 
IESON YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Aug. 26 & 27, 7:30 p.m.; Eisa parade throughout the streets of Ieson (village) with different forms of Taiko (Japanese drum) on each district of this region; 30-minute ferry ride from Motobu Port; free; 0980-49-2334. 
ITOMAN EISA FESTIVAL: Aug. 26-28, 2-10 p.m.; Eisa parade from Ganjukan to Nishikawa Community Center on Aug. 26, from 1-chome to Hamakawa Danchi (apartment complex) on Aug. 27, from Shiohira Elementary School to Ganjyukan on Aug. 28; 35-minute ride from Naha Airport; free; 0980-987-0834. 
HESHIKIYA EISA FESTIVAL: Aug. 28 & 29, 6 p.m.; youth Eisa groups with traditional forms of Taiko and perform Eisa dance at Uragahama Park; fireworks at finale; Uruma city; 098-979-2231. 
YOMITAN VILLAGE TAKASHIHO STREETS EISA PARADISE: Aug. 29, 3-6 p.m.; youth Eisa groups parade along with standard-bearers, street dancers’ performance and more; Takashiho Streets of Yomitan village; on the route 6; 098-958-6494. 
KADENA EISA MATSURI: Aug. 29, 7 p.m.; Eisa groups from Kadena town parade at Shinmachi Streets, 60-minute drive from Naha Airport; free; 098-956-2810. 
September 
60TH ALL OKINAWA EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 4, 6-9 p.m. at the Goya crossroads; Sept. 5, 3-9 p.m., Sept. 6, 2:30-9 p.m. at Okinawa City Koza Athletic Park; groups from Okinawa perform Eisa, Sanshin and taiko at Koza Athletic Park Athletic Field; fireworks at 8:45 p.m.; 1,000-1,500-2,500 yen; 098-989-5566. 
URUMA EISA MATSURI: Sept. 11, 6:30-9 p.m. & Sept. 12 & 13, 4-9 p.m.; youth Eisa groups and parade along the street of Uruma City Hall Gushikawa Office Building on Sept. 11, and at Yonashiro Sogo Koen Athletic Field Sept. 12 & 13; also fireworks at 8:40 p.m. on weekend; 70-minute drive from Naha Airport; 098-965-5634. 
26TH NAGO YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 12, 3:30 p.m.; youth Eisa groups from Nago city and neighboring cities parade at the 21st Century Forest Park outdoor stage, 20-minute drive from Naha Airport; free; 0980-53-5429. 
GINOWAN YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 12 & 13, 5-9 p.m.; 10 youth groups from Ginowan city perform Eisa at Ginowan Citizen Square (Shimin Hiroba); fireworks 8:50-9 p.m. Sun.; 20-minute ride from Kitanakagusuku IC or Nishihawa IC on Okinawa Express; 098-893-4431. 
YOMITAN VILLAGE YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 13, 2 p.m.; includes taiko (Japanese drums), and fireworks; Yomitan Village Heiwa-no Mori Stadium, 30-minute ride from Okinawa North IC on Okinawa Express, 70-minute ride from Naha Airport; 098-982-9200. 
KITANAKAGUSUKU VILLAGE EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 13, 3-9 p.m.; groups from Kitanakagusuku village perform Eisa; fireworks 9 p.m. at Kitanakagusuka Joseki (castle ruin); 50- minute ride from Naha Airport; 098-935-2233. 
NANJO YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Sept. 20, noon-9 p.m.; youth groups from Nanjo city perform Eisa; includes taiko (Japanese drums) and local entertainments at Gusuku Road Koen, 40-minute ride from Naha Airport; free; 090-5470-0123. 
WORLDWIDE EISA CONTEST 2015: Sept. 21-23; contest has three divisions — ages 8 years & younger, ages 15 years & younger and open division — at National Theatre Okinawa, 20-minute taxi ride from Naha Airport; 1,500 yen qualifiers, 2,000 yen final; 098-987-0926. 
October 
YAESE YOUTH EISA FESTIVAL: Oct. 11, noon-9 p.m.; Yaese Town’s five youth groups perform at Yaese Kochinda Undo Koen Athletic Field, 30-minute ride from Naha Airport; free parking available; 098-998-4334. Join the conversation and share your voice.
